title: PS5 Pro and PSSR impress in The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered
description: I think it's fair to say that The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered is perhaps not the highest priority when it comes to receiving a PS5 Pro upgrade. Packing a reasonable 1440p60 and 4K30 performance split on base PS5 consoles, the game was already delivering a good visual experience on Sony's 2020 hardware - but there is a compromise between image fluidity and image clarity. Part 2's PS5 Pro outing seeks to eliminate that gap, aiming to deliver a 4K-like visual experience at a full-fat 60fps frame-rate target by using Sony's new machine learning PSSR upscaling solution. How does PSSR fare in our first extended look at the technology? Is this a good replacement for native 4K, or does it fall short of that lofty target? Read more

title: Tiny Glade: an indie diorama builder that proves the power of bespoke game engines
description: Tiny Glade is the sort of indie game we love to be surprised by at Digital Foundry: one that uses seriously impressive custom tech to create something unique. Made by just a two person team, developer Pounce Light has crafted a simple and charming gameplay loop: make, create, and arrange castles, villas, or cottages to your liking using the game's flexible building system. It may be cozycore on the surface, but there's plenty of bespoke stuff driving its warm pastel aesthetic, including ray-traced global illumination (RTGI), ray-traced reflections and loads of procedural tech. Impressively, it all runs really well on near-decade-old GPUs too. RT on a GTX 1060? Believe it. Read more

title: Shadows of Doubt review - an unmatched detective simulation, when it works
description: Better strap in folks, this killer thriller has a few twists in the tale. Shadows of Doubt is, on paper, my dream game, a detective simulator where you solve procedurally generated crimes through a combination of Obra Dinn-esque deduction and Deus Ex style infiltrations. In a fully simulated city of hundreds of citizens, you solve thefts, murders, and kidnappings by legally or illegally entering homes and offices, scanning for fingerprints, searching for clues, and cross-referencing dizzying amounts of information to track down the culprit. This is Last Time I Saw You, a coming of age tale about middle schooler Ayumi who keeps seeing a mysterious girl in his dreams, but can never quite glimpse her face. It will only take you 20 minutes or so to play through its current Steam demo, but even this short glimpse into the game's opening chapter feels like a strong show of intent from developer Maboroshi Artworks. title: Atmospheric slasher Hell is Us abandons maps and quest markers, and channels brilliant immersion in return
description: Set in the early nineties, Hell is Us - the upcoming action-adventure game from developer Rogue Factor - follows Rémi on a journey to find his parents in the fictional country of Hadea. The problem? Hadea is a hermit state. The only reason why Rémi lives outside of its borders is thanks to his mother, who smuggled him out when he was five. Unfortunately, she was caught by the Hadea border control, leaving him alone and eventually entering the Canadian foster system. Her capture, and the fact that his father was a blacksmith in a village called Jova, are the only things he truly remembers from his short time in Hadea. It's due to this that Rémi, despite understanding the rationality behind his parents actions, wants to reunite with them and learn exactly why they got him out. Read more
author: Lottie Lynn

title: How PlayStation 5 Pro lays the groundwork for PS6 and beyond
description: A new DF Direct Weekly lands - as usual - today, with the team's thoughts on the recent State of Play, reaction to the most recent RTX 5080/5090 leaks and, perhaps inevitably, more PlayStation 5 Pro. However, it's actually a point raised in last week's Direct that I want to tackle in this week's blog. Many believe - with some justification - that the PS5 Pro is a step too far and that such a console isn't needed. In fact, we've made the argument ourselves. Looking back at that piece, I warned about higher costs of a Pro console, but also looked at the potential improvements it could bring - all of which have come to pass with PS5 Pro. Microsoft declined the opportunity to follow likewise, but now we have some idea of why Sony has taken a different route and perhaps more of the strategy is now understandable. Read more

title: Dead Rising Deluxe Remastered: Series S suffers, with PS5 and Series X faring better
description: Today we return to the zombie-infested shopping mall of Capcom's Dead Rising via the Deluxe Remaster - a brand new take on the 2006 original, built on RE Engine. The visual upheaval is as dramatic as you'd expect, but the original framework of the game is faithfully intact - right down to every mission objective, the layout of each segment of the mall and even the framing of its cutscenes. Still, in looking at PS5, Series X and Series S, almost every facet of the original's visuals has been rebuilt from scratch - including character models, textures, lighting, vegetation - and there's an optional modern controller scheme for moving and shooting simultaneously. Read more

title: Five Nights At Freddy's Star Josh Hutcherson Teases A Scarier Sequel
description: Last year, the film adaptation of Five Nights At Freddy's was an unexpected hit at the box office, and a sequel was confirmed earlier this year. Josh Hutcherson will reprise his role from the first film as Mike Schmidt, a night guard at a restaurant haunted by the souls of murdered children whose spirits live in disturbing animatronic creations. According to Hutcherson, the sequel is not only going to introduce more animatronics, it will also be scarier than the original."It's gonna be scarier," Hutcherson told Esquire in a new interview. "It's much bigger; the stakes are higher... There's more animatronics being brought in, different animatronics being brought in, and the world just opens up in a big way."The film will reportedly be based on the Five Nights At Freddy's 2 video game, which introduced the Puppet and Balloon Boy animatronics alongside the returning creatures Freddy, Bonnie, Chica, and Foxy. Hutcherson didn't disclose any plot details, but he did mention that it will expand the world.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Starfield Shattered Space - A House Divided Full Quest Walkthrough
description: A House Divided is one of the 11 side quests available to complete in the Starfield Shattered Space DLC. This quest centers around a courier and shipment going missing and it's your job to find out why and where the shipment could have gone. Below, you'll find a full quest walkthrough that goes through all the objectives and choices to make in A House Divided. Speak to Qisrani and access Ukaru's ComputerThe quest begins by speaking to Qisrani Ful'kehf near the House of Obedience in Dazra. After speaking to Qisrani, you'll learn of her plight, which involves a courier and shipment of missing goods. She asks that you search the computer of the courier, Ukaru Dul'kehf.Ukaru's computer is located on the Radiology floor of the Halls of Healing building, which is accessed via elevator. After you arrive on the Radiology floor, speak to the man behind the desk and tell him you need to access Ukaru's computer. He'll let you, but he'll also restrict access to the admin privileges of the computer. You can persuade him to give you admin privileges, but it's not essential to the quest.After speaking to the man, head into the room to the right and search all of the attachments on Ukaru's computer (if you have admin privileges). After learning about the shipment Ukaru was transporting, you'll learn that it supposedly went to a supply depot nearby. Track down the missing supply shipment The missing shipment takes you to a supply depot just outside Dazra. At the depot, you can enter and head down to a lower level via a vent after you arrive. Go through the vent until you reach a Supply Depot Computer. Search all of the files but specifically look at the Security Office Keycard attachment. Once you do that, look at the Supply Tracking attachment and then unlock the "Open Security Door" attachment to open the nearby door. Follow your quest marker after you're done with the computer and reach the tracking device for the shipment. You'll find Ukaru's Log #2 along with the tracking device. Once you pick up the log, you need to follow the blood trail to reach Ukaru Dul'kehf, who's locked in a chamber. Escape the gas chamber and restore power to the Depot When you reach Ukaru, a man named Brother Omanide will come over the PA system. He will attempt to kill you by locking you in the hallway and releasing gas into the room. To not die, use the vent on the right side wall and escape through the ventilation system. After getting out of the vents, you'll be in a large room with a quest marker on the other side and up some stairs. Reach the quest marker and then head down another level to reach a laboratory. Here, you need to locate four Emergency Power Cells and put them in four dedicated power slots in the nearby computer room. The quest markers for all Power Cells won't appear until you get near them, so make sure to search the entire lab and every room. Once you have four Power Cells, go to the computer room, slide each one into a power slot, and then make your way back to Ukaru, who's now dead, by following the quest marker. Taking the Supply Depot evidence to Qisrani Search Ukaru's body in the chamber and pick up the Supply Depot Recording, which is evidence you can take back to Qisrani in Dazara. When you reach Qisrani after exiting the Supply Depot, she'll be speaking with someone called Mujeen Ka'diq, who's also known as "Envoy." After Qisrani and Muljeen are finished speaking, make sure Muljeen leaves the room before revealing the evidence to Qisrani. Once you've spoken to Qisrani, you'll have to go and speak with Tevina Veth'aal, who supposedly can be trusted to decode the Supply Depot Recording. Decoding the recording and going to Jandar's RestWhen you reach Tevina in The Keep, you can show her the slate recording you found on Ukaru's body. She'll be able to decode it, which leads you to a location called Jandar's Rest. When Tevina asks you what you think the slate says, answer with "4034." When she asks what Noble House you think betrayed House Va'ruun, respond with "I'm not at liberty to say."After you're done with Tevina, head to Jandar's Rest, which is a location far to the north of Dazra. You can fast-travel to a nearby location if you've previously explored Va'ruun'kai. Upon infiltrating Jandar's Rest, you'll find plenty of Zealots to fight. However, you can simply run past them and enter Jandar's Rest. Navigating Jandar's Rest and getting into the Shrine Room Upon entering Jandar's Rest, you'll soon see a quest marker on the other end of a large cavern. There will be dozens of enemies to kill, but only one matters: the Va'ruun Zealot Captain. The captain is located on the left side of the cavern and you need to kill them in order to loot the Zealot Shrine Key, which is how you enter the room at the end of your quest marker. After killing the captain and looting the key, none of the other enemies matter, so run past them to the other end of the cavern. Enter the Shrine Room using your key and confront the head of the Zealots. Negotiating with the Zealot Boss Inside the Shrine Room is the Zealot Boss, who confronts you right away. The Zealot Boss says that he has assassins on the way to take care of Qisrani and he's reluctant to give up any information on who his contact inside Dazra is. However, you can persuade him to give up his contact by passing a persuasion check. If you fail the persuasion check, you'll have to attack the Zealot Boss. If you manage to pass the persuasion check, you'll learn the Zealots' contact is Mujeen Ka'diq. Regardless of your outcome, exit the room after the Zealot Boss is taken care of and head back to Qisrani in Dazra. Stopping assassins and searching House Ka'diq for evidenceWhen you go back to Dazra, enter the Halls of Obedience and speak with Qisrani. Inform her that her life is in jeopardy and that Mujeen Ka'diq is a traitor. She accepts this information, but she'll still want to press on and take Mujeen to trial. Before that happens, two Zealot Assassins attack within the Halls of Obedience. Dispatch of the enemies and then speak to Qisrani again.Once again, Qisrani wants to have a trial for Mujeen and air out the dirty laundry. Your next steps are either to wait for the trial to begin or search Mujeen Ka'diq's computer for more evidence. It's recommended to search for the evidence, as it makes the trial go smoother. If you choose to search Mujeen's computer, you have to hack the computer itself and a file on the computer to gain all the evidence you need. When that's done, or if you just choose to wait, find a bench, chair, or couch to sit on and wait for three hours.After the three hours is up, the trial is set to begin on the Radiology level of the Halls of Healing. Taking hush money or going forward with the trial Before you enter the room where the trial is being held, Mujeen Ka'diq will stop you. He'll ask what evidence you have and explain his reasoning behind what he did. If you're satisfied with Mujeen's side of the story, you can keep quiet about your evidence in the trial. You can do this for free or demand 10,000 Credits for your silence. If you do this, Mujeen walks free. However, if you want to see Mujeen face justice, then don't accept the bribe and proceed with the trial. Finishing the trial and complete A House DividedIn the trial room, your dialogue options will depend on what you told Mujeen. If you accepted his deal, you can say that you don't have any evidence, and he'll walk free. However, if you told him no deal, then you can present the decoded slate from the Supply Depot and evidence from his computer (if you chose to find it before the trial). All of this makes a compelling case against Mujeen, who will be taken away by security.Speak to Qisrani to complete the A House Divided quest, earning you Credits and XP for a job well done.

title: The Complete Calvin And Hobbes Is On Sale For Best Price In Years For Prime Big Deal Days
description: The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Box Set $100 (was $225) See at Amazon Calvin and Hobbes is one of the most beloved comic strips of all time. If you grew up stealing the comics section of the newspaper from your parents to read the hilarious and insightful adventures of Calvin and his stuffed Tiger, you'll want to check out Amazon's fantastic deal on The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Hardcover Box Set. As part of Amazon's early Prime Big Deal Days sale, Prime members can get the premium book box set compiling all of Bill Watterson's masterful comic strips for $100, which is 56% off its $225 list price.Amazon's price cut matches the lowest we've seen in years. The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Box Set has been on sale for $100 during past Black Friday and Prime Day sales, but it typically sells out pretty fast. If you're interested in picking this up for yourself or as a holiday gift, it'd be wise to order soon. The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Box Set $100 (was $225) The lavish hardcover box set features three volumes compiling every single comic strip from Calvin and Hobbes' run. All told, you're getting 1,440 pages of comic strips, some in color, others in black-and-white. The included slipcase features one of the illustrations that is most-associated with Calvin and Hobbes.I've owned this box set for years and can attest to its quality. The comic strips are printed on thick art paper, and the bindings have held up well. Fair warning, though: The premium materials make these books pretty heavy. With all three books in the slipcase, the set weighs roughly 22 pounds, so each hardcover is around seven pounds. See at Amazon The Complete Calvin and Hobbes certainly isn't the only way to read Watterson's beloved comic strip. If you'd rather have smaller paperback collections, check out the ongoing Calvin and Hobbes Portable Compendium series. Andrews McMeel Publishing began reprinting the series in this travel-friendly format last year. Each compendium comes with two volumes, and the first set is available for only $10 (was $22), and the second is only $12.70 ahead of Prime Big Deal Days The third set actually just released on October 1, and the fourth is available to preorder ahead of its March 2025 release.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Bowser Lego Deals At Amazon - Two Bowser Playsets On Sale For Best Prices Yet
description: Lego Super Mario: The Mighty Bowser $234 (was $270) See at Amazon The largest Super Mario Lego set has received an extremely rare discount ahead of Prime Big Deal Days. Over at Amazon, you can get The Mighty Bowser for $234 instead of its usual $270. At face value, a $36 savings isn't a huge price cut, but The Mighty Bowser has almost always sold for full price since launching two years ago. Multiple other Bowser Lego sets are discounted, too. Dry Bowser's Castle, one of the biggest Lego Super Mario playsets, is on sale for a huge 30% discount; meanwhile, Bowser's Muscle Car offers a budget-friendly King Koopa option for only $24. Lego Super Mario: The Mighty Bowser $234 (was $270) The discount is from a third-party seller, but your purchase will be shipped from Amazon and is eligible for Prime. Since your order is fulfilled by Amazon, you can return it within 30 days for free, just like any order that is officially sold by Amazon.The Mighty Bowser is certainly one of the coolest Lego Mario sets. Bowser may consistently fail in his attempts to rule the Mushroom Kingdom alongside Princess Peach, but he does own the record for highest brick count in the Lego Super Mario series. At 2,807 pieces, The Mighty Bowser stole the crown from the replica Nintendo Entertainment System kit (2,646 pieces).Once fully built, King Koopa is 12.5 inches tall and 16 inches wide, so you may need to clear some shelf space to display the big guy. With the included stand and Bowser's tail, the build has a depth of 11 inches.While you could call The Mighty Bowser a statue, it's also a giant action figure. His tail, arms, and legs are posable, so you can display Bowser in a variety of different poses. In addition to articulated joints, Bowser's jaw snaps and buttons beneath it turn his head. He can also shoot fireballs to (try to) stop Mario from thwarting his plans once again. When on his stand, Bowser is flanked on each side by fiery towers.There's also a hidden POW Block, which was implemented specifically for Lego Mario, Luigi, and Peach figures to step on. While The Mighty Bowser isn't considered a playset--it's one of the five Lego Mario sets geared primarily toward adults--it does interact with the figures included in the starter courses. If you press Lego Mario against Bowser's shell, he will react to Bowser's presence. See at Amazon Adventures with Mario Starter SetAs mentioned, The Mighty Bowser isn't the only set in the Lego Mario series focused on King Koopa. For a much more affordable option, check out Bowser's Muscle Car, which released earlier this year and is available for only $24--terrific value for a 458-piece build. In August, The Bowser Express Train became one of the largest expansion sets at 1,392 pieces. That set is $120, but you can get the 1,321-piece Dry Bowser Castle on sale for only $77 right now--a massive discount from its $110 price. It comes with a significantly smaller version of (skeletal) Bowser.It's also worth noting that you can pair The Mighty Bowser with Bowser Jr. by opting for the new edition of the Adventures with Mario Starter Set. Released in August for $50, the revamped starter set comes with the interactive Mario figure, Yoshi, Bowser Jr. and his Koopa Clown Car, and more.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: All The Upcoming MCU Movies And TV Shows For 2024 And Beyond
description: Here we goMarvel had just one movie release in 2024--Deadpool & Wolverine--but the studio is ramping things back up in 2025 with multiple major launches, including the next Captain America movie, the reintroduction of The Fantastic Four, and Thunderbolts, among others. On the TV side, Marvel has a number of projects in the works as well for Disney+. In this gallery, we're running through all of the upcoming Marvel movies and TV series in the works, and there are many.Expectations for any Marvel movie are always high, but the 2025 films--like Captain America: Brave New World and Thunderbolts--will have big shoes to fill. After all, Deadpool & Wolverine earned $1.3 billion at the worldwide box office, making it the No. 2 film of 2024 so far (only behind another Disney movie, Pixar's Inside Out 2).Here is a rundown of all the upcoming MCU projects for film and TV. We will continue to update this gallery as new information comes to light. Eyes of Wakanda – 2024 (or delayed to 2025?) An animated Disney+ series, Eye of Wakanda, was announced in 2023. It will focus on warriors from the mystical and super-scientific African nation who have been "tasked to travel the world retrieving dangerous vibranium artifacts." It was scheduled for release in 2024, but there haven't been any updates lately, suggesting it might have slipped to 2025 or beyond. Daredevil: Born Again – 2025 A TV series for Disney+ based on the Marvel character Daredevil, Daredevil: Born Again is a live-action show that brings back Charlie Cox as the title character, continuing the story originally told on Netflix's Daredevil series. The series also stars Vincent D'Onofrio, Jon Bernthal, and Michael Gandolfini. Captain America: Brave New World – 2025 Captain America: Brave New World will be the first new Marvel film in theaters since Deadpool & Wolverine. It stars Anthony Mackie as Sam Wilson, who has taken on the role of Captain America following Chris Evans' long run in the MCU. Julius Onah directs the film, which also stars Harrison Ford, Giancarlo Esposito, Liv Tyler, and Tim Blake Nelson. Thunderbolts* – May 2, 2025 No, that's not a typo–Marvel's Thunderbolts* has an asterisk in the title, but the studio has yet to confirm why. What we do know is the Jake Schreier-directed film focuses on a group of Marvel's (anti)heroes going on dangerous missions for the government, sort of like Suicide Squad. The film stars Florence Pugh, Lewis Pullman, Sebastian Stan, Rachel Weisz, Wyatt Russell, David Harbour, and Julia Louis-Dreyfus. The Fantastic Four: First Steps – July 25, 2025 Marvel is bringing back The Fantastic Four with a new film from director Matt Shakman that stars Pedro Pascal as Reed Richards, Vanessa Kirby as Sue Storm, Joseph Quinn as Johnny Storm, and Ebon Moss-Bachrach as Ben Grimm. Ironheart – 2025 A spinoff from the Black Panther franchise, Ironheart is a Disney+ show set for 2025 that stars Dominique Thorne as Riri Williams/Ironheart. The series also stars Anthony Ramos, Alden Ehrenreich, and Lyric Ross. Blade – November 7, 2025 Marvel's Blade has undergone a number of changes and has faced setbacks, but the company is now targeting the new film for release in November 2025. The film doesn't have a director attached, and the only announced cast members so far include Mahershala Ali in the lead role, alongside Mia Goth as Lilith. We wouldn't be surprised if this film gets delayed again. Avengers: Doomsday – May 1, 2026 Avengers: Doomsday is the next big Avengers movie, and it's coming May 2026. The big news is that Robert Downey Jr. is coming back to the MCU–not as Iron Man, but instead as Dr. Doom. Avengers veterans Joe and Anthony Russo are coming back to direct. Vision Quest – 2026 A spinoff from WandaVision, Vision Quest brings back Paul Bettany as Vision, with James Spader making his MCU return as Ultron. That's all there is to go on for now. Wonder Man – TBA You have no doubt heard of Wonder Woman, but Marvel is now making a Wonder Man show starring Yahya Abdul-Mateen II as Simon Williams/Wonder Man. Ben Kingsley and Ed Harris will also star on the show, which was co-created by Shang-Chi's Destin Daniel Cretton. Avengers: Secret Wars – May 7, 2027 Avengers: Secret Wars will continue where Doomsday left out when it arrives in theaters in 2027. The Russo brothers will direct this film, too, but the plot remains a secret for now. Untitled Wakanda TV series - TBA Another Black Panther spinoff is in the works, focused on the character Okoye from Black Panther: Wakanda Forever. Danai Gurira is set to return in the role, but there hasn't been much news on this project of late. What If Season 3 - TBA Marvel's What If…? Series, which digs into alternate timelines with some help from the multiverse, is coming back for a third and final season on Disney+. Season 3 will be narrated by Jeffrey Wright, with episodes focusing on characters like Red Guardian, the Avengers, Shang-Chi, and Agatha Harkness. Armor Wars – TBA An upcoming Marvel film, Armor Wars began its production as a TV show before shifting in 2022 to be made as a movie. Don Cheadle is expected to come back as James Rhodes AKA War Machine. The film is expected to tell the story of Rhodes trying to save the day after Tony Stark's futuristic technology falls into the wrong hands. Shang-Chi 2 – TBA 2021's Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings was a box office success despite releasing during the pandemic, and it also earned an Academy Award for Best Visual Effects. It took some time for a sequel to get greenlit, but it is indeed happening, with Simu Liu and director Destin Daniel Cretton coming back. Spider-Man 4 – TBA Yes, another Spider-Man movie is coming. Is that surprising? Tom Holland is expected to return for his fourth outing in a standalone Spider-Man film, which will once again be a co-production between Sony Pictures and Marvel. X-Men Reboot – TBADisney now owns X-Men and has plans to revive the franchise. In May 2024, it was reported that an X-Men reboot project was in the works with screenwriter Michael Lesslie attached. That's all we know so far, but it's exciting to think about the possibilities for a new generation of X-Men films. New Scarlett Johansson Project – TBAScarlett Johnassn starred as Black Widow in a number of Marvel films over the years, but the relationship somewhat soured over her standalone movie, Black Widow, prompting a lawsuit against Disney. The two sides eventually settled, and Johansson is staying in business with Marvel for a new project that she will produce. What it is, however, we don't know. Nova TV series – TBA Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy series is on hiatus for now, but fans of the franchise can look forward to an upcoming Disney+ series called Nova. The series follows the character Richard Rider AKA Nova as he joins Nova Corps. and embarks on a series of intergalactic missions. John C. Reilly and Glen Close are expected to reprise their Guardians characters, Rhomann Dey and Irani Rael, respectively. Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man – TBA Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man is a new TV series for Disney+ created by Jeff Trammell. It tells an origin story for Peter Parker/Spider-Man, taking place in an alternate universe where Norman Osborn was Parker's mentor, not Tony Stark.

title: Haley Joel Osment Wants To Play Link In The Zelda Movie
description: Nintendo and Sony are teaming up to make a live-action Legend of Zelda movie, and actor Haley Joel Osment wants to be in it. In a new interview, Osment said he's been a fan of the series since he was a kid and is eager to put his hat in the ring to play Link. He joked that maybe he's now too old, at 37, to play Link, but you never know."Oh, my hat's in the ring, they know my hat's been in the ring," he told IGN. "Link was like 37 when he did all this, right!? Seventeen, 37? As a kid, I was like, 'Obviously they're gonna make [Ocarina of Time] a movie soon, the story's all written out for you!' And you're like, 'That'd be very challenging to make into a compelling two-hour movie.'"Specifically, Osment said he wants to see Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask's lore be worked into the Zelda movie. He said, "Those are my original Star Wars [trilogy]."Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Joker: Folie à Deux Off To A Slow Start At The Box Office, But That's No Surprise
description: Joker: Folie à Deux is in theaters now, and, as predicted, it is not performing as well as the 2019 film right out of the gate. The sequel earned $7 million from its Thursday previews in the US, according to Variety--that is just over half of the $13.3 million that the first movie made in Thursday screenings five years ago.2019's Joker was a runaway success that went on to make over $1 billion against its relatively modest $65 million budget. The sequel, meanwhile, was never expected to match the success of the first. It had a significantly larger production budget and is tracking to earn between $50 million-$65 million for its opening weekend stateside. The original movie, meanwhile, made $96.2 million for its opening frame.For comparison, Joker: Folie à Deux's Thursday previews were less than The Flash ($9.7 million) and a bit more than The Marvels ($6.6 million).Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: A Horror Game Showcase Is Coming This Month With Dozens Of Spooky Trailers
description: October is the spookiest of months, and on the video game side, you can expect to see a new Indie Horror Showcase from DreadXP and The Media Indie Exchange on many upcoming--and possibly terrifying--games in development. This year's event will feature over 60 brand-new trailers, and the show will be hosted by horror-genre YouTuber John Wolfe when it kicks off on October 24.While DreadXP won't be showcasing any of its own in-development horror games, you can expect announcement trailers and info on demo releases from several studios and publishers behind games like the upcoming remaster of The Thing, Go Home Annie, Sniper Killer, Clock Tower: Rewind, and We Harvest Shadows. Nightdive Studios (The Thing: Remastered), Wayforward, Misfit Village, Nordcurrent Labs, Pollard Studios, Wired Productions, Torture Star Video, A La Mode Games, Akupara Games, David Wehle, and more will all have something to show. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Joker: Folie à Deux's Shocking Ending, Explained
description: Five years after 2019's Joker, the long-awaited sequel Joker: Folie à Deux is in theaters now. The film takes place in the aftermath of the original, continuing Arthur Fleck's story as he stands trial for his crimes in the earlier film. Now that the movie is out, many people are discussing the divisive ending to the film, and if you're curious to hear how it all played out, keep reading.Of course, massive spoilers for Joker: Folie à Deux follow below. GQ saw the movie and broke down the ending. A major plot point of the sequel is Arthur's courtroom trial. During the closing arguments, led by District Attorney Harvey Dent (Harry Lawtey), Arthur (Joaquin Phoenix) has an ah-ha moment and owns up to his actions. He denies that the Joker is a different persona and admits to his crimes.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Silent Hill 2 Global Launch Times Revealed
description: The Silent Hill 2 remake's October 8 release date is almost here, and developer Bloober Team has released a list of global launch times to ensure players can get their hands on the spine-chilling survival horror classic as soon as it's available.US players located in the Pacific time zone will gain access to the game--which is already earning high praise--starting at 9 PM PT on October 7, with those located in the Eastern time zone gaining access at 12 AM ET on October 8. Players who ordered the deluxe edition of the game will be able to access the game two days early on October 6, but Bloober Team hasn't shared exactly what time the game will become available for deluxe edition owners.As for the rest of the world, Silent Hill 2 will become available for purchase on Steam and PlayStation 5 at the following times:Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Has Gone Gold
description: A decade can seem like an eternity in the video game industry, and especially for fans who are eagerly awaiting the next game in a franchise. EA and BioWare released Dragon Age: Inquisition in November 2014, and it's taken almost 10 years to finally release a follow-up. But now, Dragon Age: The Veilguard has gone gold, and that means the discs are finally being pressed before they get shipped to stores.BioWare made the announcement via the official X account for Dragon Age, which playfully placed gold discs over the eyes of a skeleton.Dragon Age: The Veilguard has GONE GOLD!Thank you all for your support as we cross this important milestone. See you in Thedas on Oct. 31! Pre-order now: https://t.co/m9QGhR0odA pic.twitter.com/XQQOopRfXE — Dragon Age (@dragonage) October 4, 2024 The Veilguard takes place a decade after Inquisition, which mirrors the length of time between the two games. From what we've seen so far, things have gotten progressively worse on Thedas since the events of Inquisition. The player character, Rook, is tasked with finding new allies as they attempt to save the world. One of the more recent previews featured Rook's party in an epic battle with a dragon as well as a showdown with their mortal enemy, Ghilan'nain.Continue Reading at GameSpot

The burned-up child murderer with a razor glove who hunts kids in their sleep to kill them was played by Robert Englund in eight films and a TV series. And while many might wish he would return to the role following 2010's…Read more...

title: Classic Smokey Eyes: Honest Beauty Get It Together Eyeshadow Palette
description: Please enjoy this repost featuring one of my favorite eyeshadow palettes for easy smokey eyes. Also, side note, I need to get back on the MAC Face & Body train. I forgot how beautiful it looks in pictures! The Honest Beauty eyeshadow palette comes with a card with four looks you can do with the palette. I followed the one called “Classic Smoky Eye” for this post, although with one tweak. I started by buffing the matte beige shade (Vanilla’d Velvet) all over my lids as a base so the subsequent colors would pop a little more. I was a wee bit nervous about using the shimmery gold all over my lids and the shimmery dark purple on the outer corner because…I’m in my 40s now, and shine doesn’t always play well with my 40-something skin, particularly in the crease. Some may even say that I’m “overly picky about shimmery finishes,” *ahem*. Can you blame me though? One false move and you see every fine line! Buuuut, I decided to go for it anyway, hoping[Continue reading...] The post Classic Smokey Eyes: Honest Beauty Get It Together Eyeshadow Palette appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 850
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. A good book you’ve read recently? I really enjoyed “Killers of a Certain Age” by Deanna Raybourn. I’ve been needing a fast, fun read and it hit the spot! Next time you need a book for a plane ride or a vacation, grab it. 2. If you could move anywhere in the world without having to put any effort into it at all (assume someone takes care of the packing, logistics, paperwork, finances, etc.), where would you go? I’d move us to the Manoa neighborhood on Oahu in a heartbeat. 3. What’s a weird breakfast that you like to eat? I don’t know if it’s super weird, but I do love a toasted frozen waffle slathered with peanut butter and sprinkled with raisins. I don’t know how[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 850 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 831
description: Hiya. So, I’ve seen Harris sneaking around the neighborhood a few times lately — once, a couple days ago when he was chilling under a car out front. I was walking Marnie Mae around the circle when she started barking like mad woman at something. I crouched down to get a better look, and who do you suppose was sitting there totally chillin’ like a villain a few feet away? Yup, Harris, the neighborhood cat lothario (and, incidentally, Tabs’ former foil). Anywho, I also spotted him darting across the main street at the base of our hill (I think he was chasing a squirrel), and then again yesterday skulking through the dry grasses, presumably hunting something else. This post is a reprint in Harris’ honor. He’s still around. I believe he’s about 10 now, still doing what boy cats are apt to do (causing trouble). What’s up with these damn cat stalkers?! Every week there’s a new one trying to dominate the common area, which sucks because that’s where Tabs likes to do his morning[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 831 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

I had a lovely casual tea with my peeps, aka El Hub and Connor. 2. How organized are you? At work my organization is pretty darn great, if I do say so myself. At home it’s another story, ha ha ha! 3. One thing you need to do more often? Honestly, stretch. I’ve gotten back into the habit of *not* doing it every day and my body suffers when I’m not consistent. 4. What’s the best day of the week? Saturday! 5. One of your favorite fall activities? Does eating pecan pie count? Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen P.S. Here are the questions to copy/paste with your answers in a comment. Talk to ya soon. 1. title: Saturday Surfing, September 21, 2024!
description: Hi, friend. Happy Caturday! Goodness gracious gravy. I am overjoyed to be sitting here, just happily typing away about whatever I wanna gab on about, and to not have to deal with a myriad of last-minute, pseudo work emergencies that could’ve been avoided by taking care of one’s administrative tasks early on, OMG! Side note, my day job has been kicking my butt lately. I really do wish more people understood that 1) getting things done early makes everything easier, and 2) you get more bees with honey. Anywho, I’m overjoyed that it’s Saturday, the sun is out and that we have a good chunk of the weekend ahead of us. 🙂 Before I sat down to write, I was thinking about how sometimes, I fall into a mode where everything I want to do feels so daunting that I get overwhelmed before I even start. Like this morning, the first thing my inside voice said to me when I plopped into my chair was, “I’m too tired to sit down and bang away at[Continue reading...] The post Saturday Surfing, September 21, 2024! appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
